abstracts.cdata!:
The Bank's health sector and
            project work in Brazil started in 1976 with the inclusion of
            health components (Ln. 6273-BR) in Northeast rural
            development projects. While these components did much to
            improve access to services, they were generally not designed
            to improve the management and quality of health services.
            The Bank's first free-standing health project (Ln.
            2061-BR), in Rondonia, was designed to improve, among other
            things, access to basic health services. A second health
            project (Ln. 2447-BR) was approved in June 1984. It aimed at
            supporting the development of a new model of basic health
            services in the metropolitan area of Sao Paulo by addressing
            health care needs in an equitable and efficient manner. In
            April 1985 the Brazilian Government approved a 15-year
            development plan for the Northeast region. The health part
            of this plan was the Northeast Basic Health Services Project
            which would be implemented in three phases, according to the
            different capacities of the states to carry it out. The
            Government of Brazil requested Bank financial support to
            that effect. The main objective of the Project was to
            support the Borrower's effort to improve equity,
            efficiency and effectiveness of basic health care in the
            project area by: (a) improving and expanding the operation
            of the basic health facilities network; and (b) improving
            the institutional capabilities of the Ministry of Health
            (MOH) and State Health Secretariats (SESs). The project was
            designed to assist the Government in improving the health
            status of the rural poor, about 5 million small farm
            families, living in four states of the Northeast of Brazil
            (Bahia, Rio Grande do Norte, Piaui and a part of Minas Gerais).
